intro: Stillingia discolor, commonly known as the purplestem stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its distinctive purple stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Stillingia discolor is a perennial herb that has limited commercial use but is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences.
